## GAD-7 vs BRFSS

GAD-7 vs BRFSS: Simplifying Psychometric Harmonisation The need for robust psychometric harmonisation has become increasingly relevant, especially when dealing with data from wide-ranging sources. A prevalent case is the harmonisation of the Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7) and the CDC Behavioural Risk Factor Surveillance System Survey (BRFSS). GAD-7 and BRFSS are pivotal questionnaires often utilized by psychologists; yet, the time-consuming, error-prone task of comparing and harmonising the responses creates the potential for inaccuracies. This is where Harmony software's role becomes indispensable. Harmony's innovative software utilizes advanced algorithms to enable rigorous harmonisation of vast arrays of data across diverse questionnaires. It simplifies the GAD-7 vs BRFSS harmonisation process by providing accurate matches between GAD-7 and BRFSS through its unique generative AI models and natural language processing. Notably, the software is designed with a user-friendly interface that allows researchers to import their own questionnaires, including GAD-7 and BRFSS, and achieve on-spot harmonisation. So, whether youâ€™re working with items from GAD-7, BRFSS, or a wide range of other questionnaires, Harmony can mitigate your harmonisation troubles. GAD-7 vs BRFSS harmonisation is now more accessible and reliable with Harmony software. With Harmony, psychologists can keep focusing on their primary goal of investigating and improving mental health, rather than wrestling with tedious harmonisation tasks. In  psychometrics, GAD-7 vs BRFSS is just one of the countless harmonisation scenarios Harmony can handle with ease and precision.

## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
